perturbation.original_text: Each Party irrevocably consents to the exclusive jurisdiction, forum and venue of any state or federal court sitting in New York City in the State of New York over any and all claims, disputes, controversies or disagreements between the Parties or any of their respective Affiliates, successors and assigns under or related to this Agreement or any of the transactions contemplated hereby, including their execution, performance or enforcement, whether in contract, tort or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party consents to the jurisdiction, forum and venue of any court over any and all claims, disputes, controversies or disagreements between the Parties or any of their respective Affiliates, successors and assigns under or related to this Agreement or any of the transactions contemplated hereby, including their execution, performance or enforcement, whether in contract, tort or otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'irrevocably' and 'exclusive jurisdiction' along with specifying 'state or federal court sitting in New York City', the modified clause weakens the commitment to a specific jurisdiction. This may allow for disputes to be heard in jurisdictions less favorable to one of the parties, potentially violating principles of fair venue and access to justice which are considered consumer rights under US law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Fair Venue and Access to Justice, U.S. Constitution and various state laws ensuring fair legal processes

perturbation.original_text: In accordance with Section 11.03 and Section 11.04, at any time after giving notice of a Dispute, each Party shall be entitled to interim measures of protection duly granted by a court of competent jurisdiction: (1) to preserve the status quo pending resolution of the Dispute; (2) to prevent the destruction or loss of documents and other information or things relating to the Dispute; or (3) to prevent the transfer, disposition or hiding of assets. Any such interim measure (or a request therefor to a court of competent jurisdiction) shall not be deemed incompatible with the provisions of Section 11.02, Section 11.03 and Section 11.04. Until such Dispute is resolved in accordance with Section 11.02 or final judgment is rendered in accordance with Section 11.03 and Section 11.04, each Party agrees that such Party shall continue to perform its obligations under this Agreement and that such obligations shall not be subject to any defense or set-off, counterclaim, recoupment or termination.
perturbation.changed_text: At any time after giving notice of a Dispute, each Party may request interim measures of protection. Until such Dispute is resolved, each Party agrees that such Party shall continue to perform its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states the right to interim measures of protection granted by a court of competent jurisdiction. The modified clause omits the reference to court-ordered protection and removes specific protective measures, weakening a party's ability to protect its interests during a dispute. This could violate principles of equitable remedies, which are implied consumer protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Equitable Remedies, U.S. legal system

perturbation.original_text: Subject to Section 11.02 and Section 11.05, in the event of any actual or threatened default in, or breach of, any of the terms, conditions and provisions of this Agreement, the affected Party shall have the right to specific performance and injunctive or other equitable relief of its rights under this Agreement, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies at Law or in equity, and all such rights and remedies shall be cumulative. The other Party shall not oppose the granting of such relief on the basis that money damages are an adequate remedy. The Parties agree that the remedies at Law for any breach or threatened breach hereof, including monetary damages, are inadequate compensation for any loss and that any defense in any action for specific performance that a remedy at Law would be adequate is waived. Any requirements for the securing or posting of any bond with such remedy are waived.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of any actual default in, or breach of, any of the terms, conditions and provisions of this Agreement, the affected Party shall have the right to remedies at Law.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly grants the right to specific performance and injunctive relief. The modified clause removes the possibility of specific performance or injunctive relief, limiting the affected party's remedy to only remedies at Law, which are usually monetary damages. This is a significant omission, particularly for intellectual property agreements where monetary damages may not be adequate compensation for the loss of unique rights and it violates consumer protection for equitable relief.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection for Equitable Relief and Adequacy of Legal Remedies, U.S. legal system
